Hey, welcome back to how I built this resilience Edition.

So one of the knocks on Teach for America has been that they recruit teachers who don't share the same backgrounds as the kids in the communities they serve so when I spoke with TFA is CEO Elisa Villanueva beard.
segments.phrase: the same background

segments.phrase: white middle class

segments.text: What is TFA doing to meet the critics and to recruit more teachers of
segments.phrase: white middle class

segments.text: It's such an important question guide appreciate you raising it.
So, I mean, I'm happy to say that over the last six years.

We have fielded a core that is at least 50% people of color this last year was just over fifty percent people of color and because we understand the importance This and have worked really hard to put forward the resources to ensure that we are able to attract a strong racially, ethnically and socioeconomically diverse core.

And so I would say we are now among the largest and actually most ethnically diverse and racially diverse group of Educators going into low-income communities and further about a third of our new core members are first generation college graduates.
So this is something that we have taken on believe.
It's so important and have it as a top priority and will and it's a commitment that we will continue
carry forward.

I mean is it have you seen a drop off an applications?
Have you seen people withdrawing from the
We are in the middle of our recruitment season right now to answer your first question about people dropping out.
I mean that the answer to that is no I mean we the again the Instead of the Educators who just know their role is so important and in the midst of a lot of chaos, as you can imagine guy in for us.
We're in 37 States and Washington DC with very different policies and very different rules.
Some of our core members are facing realities where they are having to report to schools where there is no requirement of a mask.
There are no safety precautions to than other extremes that you know are not in person.
And so it's just so much to manage.

In our folks have just continued to show up and we continue to figure out how do we really hold our Educators In This Moment the safety of them and our students at the same time in terms of the recruitment where the middle of the Season we are watching that, you know, we're having to recruit virtually which is completely new and different for us and we're watching timeline.
